required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety and Tolerability Study of Adalimumab in Subjects With Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi Center, Open Label Study of the Human Anti TNF Monoclonal Antibody Adalimumab to Evaluate the Long Term Safety and Tolerability of Repeated Administration of Adalimumab in Subjects With Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the long-term maintenance of response, safety and tolerability of repeated administration of adalimumab in subjects with Crohn's disease who participated in and successfully completed Protocol M02-404 or Protocol M04-691.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Clinical Remission
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as a Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) score of < 150. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as a Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) score of < 150. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 108
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as a Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) score of < 150. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 204
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as a Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) score of < 150. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Clinical Response 100 (CR-100)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 156
secondary_outcome.description: A CR-100 is a decrease from baseline in CDAI score of 100 or more points. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Clinical Response 70 (CR-70)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 156
secondary_outcome.description: A CR-70 is a decrease from baseline in CDAI score of 70 or more points. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Steroid-free Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 156
secondary_outcome.description: Steroid-free remission was achieved if the subject stopped taking steroids before the visit and had a Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) score of <150. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Steroid-free CR-100
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 156
secondary_outcome.description: Steroid-free CR-100 was achieved if the subject stopped taking steroids before the visit and had a decrease from baseline in CDAI score of 100 or more points at that visit. The CDAI is a weighted composite score of 8 clinical factors measured over a 1-week period. A lower CDAI score indicates lesser disease severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Fistula Remission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 156
secondary_outcome.description: Fistula remission was defined as the absence of draining fistulas in subjects with fistula present at the preceding study's baseline visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Serious Infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Serious infections are infectious adverse events that meet at least one criterion for a serious adverse event (e.g., death, life threatening event, hospitalization) including tuberculosis (TB), bacterial sepsis, invasive fungal infections (e.g., histoplasmosis), and infections due to other opportunistic pathogens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Malignancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Lymphoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Nonmelanoma Skin Cancer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Malignancy (Excluding Nonmelanoma Skin Cancer and Lymphoma)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Malignancy (Including Lymphoma, Excluding Nonmelanoma Skin Cancer)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Injection Site Reaction-related Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment
secondary_outcome.description: An injection site reaction is any adverse event corresponding to a preferred term beginning with "injection site" excluding injection site arthritis, injection site movement impairment, injection site photosensitivity, injection site joint effusion, injection site joint inflammation, injection site scab, injection site joint pain, or injection site laceration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Opportunistic Infection (Excluding Tuberculosis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Congestive Heart Failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Demyelinating Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Hepatic-related Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Allergic Reaction-related Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Lupus-like Syndrome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Hematologic-related Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Fatal Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment

intervention.description: Adalimumab 40 mg by subcutaneous injection every other week or every week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must have successfully completed either the M02-404 (NCT00077779) or M04-691 (NCT00105300) protocol to be eligible for this study
- Diagnosis of Crohn's disease
- Willing and able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of ulcerative colitis
- Women cannot be pregnant or breastfeeding
- Previous history of listeria infection or untreated tuberculosis
- Previous history of cancer other than successfully treated skin cancer or carcinoma-in-situ of the cervix

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 262 weeks of adalimumab treatment (includes adalimumab treatment in previous study)

group.title: Open-label Adalimumab
group.description: 40 mg by subcutaneous injection every other week or every week

event.sub_title: Red blood cell sedimentation rate increased

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, should provide written notification to Abbott within 60 days of their presentation/publication. Abbott requests that no presentation/publication will be allowed until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay of any proposed presentation/publication maybe requested if Abbott needs to secure patent or other proprietary protection.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was stopped by the sponsor in December 2008 when the pre-specified termination criteria were met. Subjects who continued in the study through the termination date were considered as having completed the study.
